briefTitle: The Effects of Upper Extremity Lymphedema on Posture, Upper Extremity Functions, and Quality of Life
officialTitle: The Effects of Extremity With Lymphedema on Posture, Upper Extremity Functions, and Quality of Life in Patients With Lymphedema After Unilateral Breast Cancer
conditions: Breast Cancer Related Lymphedema, Breast Cancer-Related Arm Lymphedema
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder, and Hand (DASH)
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Volunteering to participate in the research
* Be between the ages of 18-50
* Having had unilateral breast cancer
* At least one year since breast cancer treatment
* No active metastases

Exclusion Criteria:

* Arthritis
* Fibromyalgia syndrome
* Neurological diseases
* Mental illnesses
* Myopathic diseases
* Bilateral upper extremity lymphedema
* Inability to communicate and cooperate
* Presence of any orthopaedic disease in the affected upper extremity
* Having scoliosis
* Having cognitive problems
